main_definition: To close and open one' or eyes quickly, often involuntarily as a reflex.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A quick closing and opening of the eye(s)
meanings_and_examples.example: When someone suddenly looks at bright light, they instinctively blink.
After hearing some surprising news, she couldn't help but blink in surprise.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A sudden change or reversal in a situation
meanings_and_examples.example: When the team unexpectedly won against their rivals, it was a complete blink of an eye.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To reveal something temporarily before hiding it again
meanings_and_examples.example: 'She blinked' as if to say her secret thoughts were just briefly exposed.
